resources.string: Do you want to fail the test?
Bluetooth Scan Test passed.\n Device(s) scanned:\n BT Device - %1$s
The App requires a few mandatory permissions in order to function properly. Allow all permissions when prompted. Tap on OK to continue and Cancel to exit the App.
Some permissions were denied. All permissions are mandatory for the App to function properly. Allow all permissions when prompted again. Tap on OK to continue or Cancel to exit the App.
Some required permissions by the app were still denied. Tap on Settings and then tap on Permissions to manually enable all permissions
Please select at-least one item to continue.
Analyze my device will perform all automatic tests and give you the option to select additional manual tests.
Please check your internet connection and try again.
Storage is full. Free up some space to perform the test.
We\’re not able to reach the server. Your transaction data will not be saved.
We hope that you are enjoying using ORUphones app.\nPlease take a moment to rate us on the app store
Place your hand over the top of the phone.\nNote: Ensure that you are in a bright area while performing the test.
Move your hand over the top of the phone to test the ambient light sensor.
Rotate your device to change the display between vertical and horizontal views.
Did the image on the screen rotate correctly?
Move your palm very close to top half of the device first and then move your palm back and forth from left to right.
Place your hand over the Proximity Sensor as shown in the image.
Wave your hand over the sensor as shown. The test should pass automatically.
Speak into the microphone and listen to the playback from the speaker.
Tap on \'Record\' and speak to record the audio.
Tap on \'Play\' and listen to the recorded audio.
Did you hear the recorded audio?

• Check for blocked openings 
• Remove the screen case 
• Clean the microphone openings 
• Unplug any accessories(Bluetooth or any other)

 Tap on 'Retry' if you want to perform the test again, else tap on 'Fail' to fail the test.
Test device buttons by pressing each one.
Test the device buttons by pressing each shown below.
Do all the circles have a checkmark?
Please wait for app to relaunch.
Test the soft keys on your device by touching each one.
Listen carefully to the speaker and type in the numbers you heard
Please enter the numbers you heard from the speaker
We have turned up your volume and will reset it later.
Listen carefully with your phone close to your ear and type in the number on screen.
Please enter the numbers you heard from the earpiece
Test the Earpiece by listening to the numbers illustrated in the audio played
Please enter the numbers you heard from the earpiece
Tap or swipe all of the squares on the screen to turn them blue.
Did all of the squares turn blue?
Tap or swipe all of the squares on the screen with your Spen to turn them blue
Place your hand in front of the Camera and tap the Red button to take the picture.
Test the rear camera by taking the picture of your hand.
Test the rear camera video by recording a video.
Did the device record a clear video?
Test the forward facing camera video by recording a video.
Did the device record a clear video?
Face the Front camera and take a picture of your face by tapping the Red button.
Test the forward facing camera by taking a picture of your face.
Start the test and count the number of times the Camera LED light flashes
How many times did the camera LED light flash?
Tap the screen to change colors to white, gray, black, red, green, and blue. Look for missing pixels or uneven colors.
Is the display free of dead pixels and discoloration?
Long press to select coloured dots (double tap to deselect). Swipe to continue. \n\nBlack and white screens will be presented​.
Did you tap on any coloured dots?
Long press to select discolored area (double tap to deselect). Swipe to continue. \n\n​White and Grey screens will be presented.
Did you outline any discolored areas on screen?
Long press to select burn-in areas (double tap to deselect). Swipe to continue. ​\n\nGrey and white screens will be presented​.
Did you outline any burn-in areas on screen?
Please connect your wired headphones. \nWireless headphones cannot be tested. \nPlease press Skip button, if you don\’t have headphones.
Please connect your wired headphones. \n Wireless headphones cannot be tested.
Now let\'s listen to the music being \nplayed through your earphone.
Connect your earphones to play audio.
Once the test begins, tap the screen 3 times. Please observe the screen brightness changes.
Did you observe the changes in screen brightness?
App will now initiate a call. Wait until you hear an auto attendant prompt before you end the call.
Were you able to hear an automated message?
This feature is already being used successfully
Count the number of times your phone vibrates and enter the number on screen
How many times did your device vibrate?
Let us check if your device is able to recognize a USB connection. Please connect your device to a working USB cable.
You will need a USB Cable handy for this test.
Did the USB port work properly?
Let us check if your device charging capability is working as intended.Please connect your device to the wall charger.
Did the device charging work properly?

• Remove any debris from the charging port on the bottom of your device 
• Check your charging cable and USB adapter for signs of damage, like breakage or bent prongs 

 Tap on 'Retry' if you want to perform the test again, Else tap on 'Fail' to fail the test.
Tests the ability to recognize a Bluetooth device within its vicinity.
Test the ability to recognize a WIFI device within it\'s vicinity.
Wifi seems to be off, please click on Wifi Settings button to turn on wifi.
Bring the NFC card or Nfc enabled device near the phone to test whether your NFC is in working conditions
Put your device near NFC devices to scan.
Plug in your earphones. Make sure your device indicates \"Connected\" status.
When you plugged the headphones in did the device respond?
To measure battery consumption you must activate Airplane Mode on your device. This test will take about 5 minutes to complete.
Please go to settings->accessibility and turn on all sounds to continue test.
You can plug your earphones back
You can now unplug your earphones.
Search for Pervacio Mobile Diagnostics app and enable the usage stats permission
Search for Pervacio Mobile Diagnostics app and enable \'All Files Access\' permission
Please turn on Pervacio tool in Accessibility service.
Please enable permission to change DO Not Disturb mode to perform Audio tests.
Keeping Wi-Fi turned off when not in use extends battery life
Keeping Wi-fi turned OFF when not in using internet can extend battery life.​
It is recommended to turn ON the Wifi.​
Battery Performance test is not supported for this device.
Bluetooth can have an effect on battery life. To extend battery life turn Bluetooth off when not in use.
Bluetooth Setting is turned OFF on this device. To enable Bluetooth, please change the slider to ON position.
Note:some applications may require a Bluetooth Connection to function properly.
Please disable Location Services and GPS.
Please enable Location Services and GPS.
GPS can have an effect on battery life. To extend battery life turn GPS off when not in use.
GPS Setting is turned OFF on this device. To enable GPS, please Go to Settings using the button below.
Note:some applications may require a GPS signal to function properly.
NFC can have an effect on battery life. To extend battery life turn NFC off when not in use.
NFC Setting is turned OFF on this device. To enable NFC, please Go to Settings using the button below.
Keeping Mobile hotspot turned off when not in use can extend your device’s battery life.
Unable to turn off live wallpaper
Live wallpaper can have a signiﬁcant impact on battery life. To extend battery life turn use a photo wallpaper or stock image.
Screen time out: Not set to 1 minute
Screen time out: Set to 1 minute
Extending the screen timeout beyond one minute can have an effect on battery life.

Please capture the device IMEl by following the steps below:

1. Touch the Start button to open the phone dialer.
2. Enter the code *#06#.
3. Take a screenshot of IMEl by holding down Power button and Volume Down key at the same time.
4. Hold them down until you hear an audible click or a screenshot sound.
5. Tap OK on the IMEI popup.
6. Press the Back Key.
7. Continue with the diagnosis.

Pervacio Privacy Policy

 

Thank you for choosing to be part of our community at Pervacio India Private Limited (“Company”, “we”, “us”, or “our”). We are committed to protecting your personal information and your right to privacy. If you have any questions or concerns about our notice, or our practices with regards to your personal information, please contact us at support@pervacio.com

 

When you visit our website, mobile application, and use our services, you trust us with your personal information. We take your privacy very seriously. In this privacy notice, we seek to explain to you in the clearest way possible what information we collect, how we use it and what rights you have in relation to it. We hope you take some time to read through it carefully, as it is important. If there are any terms in this privacy notice that you do not agree with, please discontinue use of our Sites or Apps and our services.

 

This privacy notice applies to all information collected through our website, mobile application, (“Apps”), and/or any related services, sales, marketing or events (we refer to them collectively in this privacy notice as the “Services”).

 

Please read this privacy notice carefully as it will help you make informed decisions about sharing your personal information with us.

 

Table of Contents

 

  1. What information do we collect?
  2. How do we use your information?
  3. Will your information be shared with anyone?
  4. How long do we keep your information?
  5. How do we keep your information safe?
  6. Do we collect information from minors?
  7. What are your privacy rights?
  8. Controls for do-not-track features
  9. Do California residents have specific privacy rights?
  10. Do we make updates to this policy?
  11. How can you contact us about this policy?
  12. How can you review, update, or delete the data we collect from you?

 

1. What information do we collect?

 

In Short: We may collect information regarding your mobile device, when you use our apps.

If you use our Apps, we may also collect the following information:

Mobile Device Access. We may request access or permission to certain features from your mobile device, including your mobile device ’s bluetooth, camera, microphone, sensors, contacts, calendar, reminders, storage, and other features. If you wish to change our access or permissions, you may do so in your device ’s settings.

Mobile Device Data. We may automatically collect device information (such as your mobile device ID, model and manufacturer), operating system, version information and IP address.

 

2. How do we use your information?

 

In Short: We process your information for purposes based on legitimate business interests, the fulfillment of our contract with you, compliance with our legal obligations, and/or your consent.

We use personal information collected via our Services or Apps for a variety of business purposes described below. We process your personal information for these purposes in reliance on our legitimate business interests, in order to enter into or perform a contract with you, with your consent, and/or for compliance with our legal obligations. We indicate the specific processing grounds we rely on next to each purpose listed below.

We use the information we collect or receive:

  • To enforce our terms, conditions and policies for Business Purposes, Legal Reasons and Contractual.
  • To respond to legal requests and prevent harm. If we receive a subpoena or other legal request, we may need to inspect the data we hold to determine how to respond.
  • To deliver device grading services to you. We may use your information to provide you with the requested service.

 

3. Will your information be shared with anyone?

 

In Short: We only share information with your consent, to comply with laws, to provide you with services, to protect your rights, or to fulfill business obligations.

We may process or share data based on the following legal basis:

Consent: We may process your data if you have given us specific consent to use your personal information in a specific purpose.

Legitimate Interests: We may process your data when it is reasonably necessary to achieve our legitimate business interests.

Performance of a Contract: Where we have entered into a contract with you, we may process your personal information to fulfill the terms of our contract.

Legal Obligations: We may disclose your information where we are legally required to do so in order to comply with applicable law, governmental requests, a judicial proceeding, court order, or legal process, such as in response to a court order or a subpoena (including in response to public authorities to meet national security or law enforcement requirements).

Vital Interests: We may disclose your information where we believe it is necessary to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding potential violations of our policies, suspected fraud, situations involving potential threats to the safety of any person and illegal activities, or as evidence in litigation in which we are involved.

More specifically, we may need to process your data or share your personal information in the following situations:

Vendors, Consultants and Other Third-Party Service Providers: We may share your data with third party vendors, service providers, contractors or agents who perform services for us or on our behalf and require access to such information to do that work. Examples include: payment processing, data analysis, email delivery, hosting services, customer service and marketing efforts. We may allow selected third parties to use tracking technology on the Services or Apps, which will enable them to collect data about how you interact with the Services or Apps over time. This information may be used to, among other things, analyze and track data, determine the popularity of certain content and better understand online activity. Unless described in this Policy, we do not share, sell, rent or trade any of your information with third parties for their promotional purposes.

Business Transfers: We may share or transfer your information in connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business to another company.

Third-Party Advertisers: We may use third-party advertising companies to serve ads when you visit the Services or Apps. These companies may use information about your visits to our Website(s) and other websites that are contained in web cookies and other tracking technologies in order to provide advertisements about goods and services of interest to you.

 

4. How long do we keep your information?

 

In Short: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes outlined in this privacy notice unless otherwise required by law.

We will only keep your personal information for as long as it is necessary for the purposes set out in this privacy notice, unless a longer retention period is required or permitted by law (such as tax, accounting or other legal requirements). No purpose in this policy will require us keeping your personal information for longer than 90 days.

When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your personal information, we will either delete or anonymize it, or, if this is not possible (for example, because your personal information has been stored in backup archives), then we will securely store your personal information and isolate it from any further processing until deletion is possible.

 

5. How do we keep your information safe?

 

In Short: We aim to protect your personal information through a system of organizational and technical security measures.

We have implemented appropriate technical and organizational security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process. However, please also remember that we cannot guarantee that the internet itself is 100% secure. Although we will do our best to protect your personal information, transmission of personal information to and from our Services or Apps is at your own risk. You should only access the services within a secure environment.

 

6. Do we collect information from minors?

 

In Short: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age.

We do not knowingly solicit data from or market to children under 18 years of age. By using the Services or Apps, you represent that you are at least 18 or that you are the parent or guardian of such a minor and consent to such minor dependent ’s use of the Services or Apps. If we learn that personal information from users less than 18 years of age has been collected, we will deactivate the account and take reasonable measures to promptly delete such data from our records. If you become aware of any data we have collected from children under age 18, please contact us at support@pervacio.com

 

7. What are your privacy rights?

 

In Short: You may review, change, or terminate your account at any time.

If you are resident in the European Economic Area and you believe we are unlawfully processing your personal information, you also have the right to complain to your local data protection supervisory authority. You can find their contact details here: http://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/bodies/authorities/index_en.htm.

 

8. Controls for do-not-track features

 

Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and mobile applications include a Do-Not-Track (“DNT”) feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected. No uniform technology standard for recognizing and implementing DNT signals has been finalized. As such, we do not currently respond to DNT browser signals or any other mechanism that automatically communicates your choice not to be tracked online. If a standard for online tracking is adopted that we must follow in the future, we will inform you about that practice in a revised version of this privacy notice.

 

9. Do California residents have specific privacy rights?

 

In Short: Yes, if you are a resident of California, you are granted specific rights regarding access to your personal information.

California Civil Code Section 1798.83, also known as the “Shine The Light” law, permits our users who are California residents to request and obtain from us, once a year and free of charge, information about categories of personal information (if any) we disclosed to third parties for direct marketing purposes and the names and addresses of all third parties with which we shared personal information in the immediately preceding calendar year. If you are a California resident and would like to make such a request, please submit your request in writing to us using the contact information provided below.

If you are under 18 years of age, reside in California, and have a registered account with the Services or Apps, you have the right to request removal of unwanted data that you publicly post on the Services or Apps. To request removal of such data, please contact us using the contact information provided below, and include the email address associated with your account and a statement that you reside in California. We will make sure the data is not publicly displayed on the Services or Apps, but please be aware that the data may not be completely or comprehensively removed from our systems.

 

10. Do we make updates to this policy?

 

In Short: Yes, we will update this policy as necessary to stay compliant with relevant laws.

We may update this privacy notice from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated “Revised” date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible. If we make material changes to this privacy notice, we may notify you either by prominently posting a notice of such changes or by directly sending you a notification. We encourage you to review this privacy notice frequently to be informed of how we are protecting your information.

 

11. How can you contact us about this policy?

 

If you have questions or comments about this policy, you may email us at privacy@pervacio.com or by post to:

5215 N O ’Connor Blvd, 11th Floor, Irving TX 75039
Telephone: +1 888 221 4762

 

12. How can you review, update, or delete the data we collect from you?

 

Based on the laws of some countries, you may have the right to request access to the personal information we collect from you, change that information, or delete it in some circumstances. To request to review, update, or delete your personal information, please submit a request to privacy@pervacio.com. We will respond to your request within 30 days.

Error logs be included with this report. No personal information is collected.for more information please review the Content Protection Policy

As with any standard computer software application support, this tool employs log files which records data from usage of tool . The data gathered is non-personal and may include details of your mobile device make and model, serial number, firmware version, platform type, data type and amount, date/time stamp which will be protected in accordance with Pervacio\'s privacy policies.

Google account must be removed before trading in your device. Please remove Google account by tapping on ‘Go to Settings’ button.
SIM Card must be removed before trading in your device. Please remove SIM card from the SIM slot and tap OK.
SD Card must be removed before trading in your device. Please remove SD card from the SD card slot and tap OK.
PIN/Pattern/Password must be removed before trading in your device. Please remove PIN/Pattern/Password and tap OK.

We need you to agree that Telefonica Brasil S.A. do not accept any liability for any loss of personal data including, but not limited to Contacts, SMS Content, Account Settings, Multi-media, Photographs & Videos or application / social media settings and or passwords, neither do we accept any liability for any damage caused to the device. Telefonica Brasil S.A. will also gather anonymous data about your appointment and device for the purpose of improving the service, this will include technical information about health checks and diagnostics, this can include the IMEI of the devices we work on. By signing this document, you give Telefonica Brasil S.A. permission to share core data and install third party applications on to your device for the purpose of diagnostics, health checks and data transfers, as approved by Telefonica Brasil S.A, where necessary. We will not store any personal data on our workstations.

Necesitamos que este de acuerdo que no se acepta ninguna responsabilidad por la pérdida de datos personales, incluidos, entre otros, contactos, contenido de SMS, configuración de la cuenta, multimedia, fotografías y videos o configuración de aplicaciones / redes sociales o contraseñas, ni aceptamos cualquier responsabilidad por cualquier daño causado al dispositivo. Se recopilará algunos datos anónimos con el fin de mejorar el servicio, esto incluirá información técnica sobre controles y diagnósticos de salud, esto puede incluir el IMEI de los dispositivos en los que trabajamos. Al firmar este documento, nos otorga permiso para compartir datos básicos e instalar aplicaciones de terceros en su dispositivo con el fin de realizar diagnósticos, verificaciones de estado y transferencias de datos, cuando sea necesario. No almacenaremos ningún dato personal como fotos, videos, música, claves, correos y contactos.

We need you to agree that Telefónica UK ltd does not accept any liability for any loss of personal data including, but not limited to Contacts, SMS Content, Account Settings, Multi-media, Photographs & Videos or application / social media settings and or passwords, neither do we accept any liability for any damage caused to the device. Telefónica UK Ltd will also gather anonymous data about your appointment and device for the purpose of improving the service, this will include technical information about health checks and diagnostics, this can include the IMEI of the devices we work on. By signing this document, you give Telefónica UK Ltd permission to share core data and install third party applications on to your device for the purpose of diagnostics, health checks and data transfers, as approved by Telefónica UK Ltd, where necessary. We will not store any personal data on our workstations.

 

Pervacio Device Diagnostics App requests a number of permissions to test the device\'s hardware components and evaluate the condition of your device.  We will ask for the following permissions:

 

  • Sensors:  We use this permission to read sensors and ensure they are working (i.e. accelerometer, magnetometer etc.).
  • Location:  We use this permission to access precise GPS location (GPS & network based) to ensure store has permission to use the app.
  • Camera: We use this permission to take pictures & videos to ensure camera is working.
  • Storage: We use this permission to read storage capacity of your phone.
  • Other: We use these permissions to test the device\'s hardware components, evaluate the condition of your device and remove necessary locks (with your consent) to prepare your device for return/ for trade-in.

   •Access Flashlight

   •Access Bluetooth settings

   •Control vibration

   •Have full network access

   •View network connections

   •Prevent phone from sleeping

   •View Wi-Fi connections

   •Pair with Bluetooth devices

   •Record & Playback Audio

   •Check for presence of Google Account

 

By tapping I AGREE, you acknowledge and agree to the above terms and conditions and have read the Privacy Statement.
